question: According to the Hanafi Madhab
answer:
QUESTION

Assalamu Aliakum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuhu,

 

Jazak Allah khair for answering our questions, and helping us to follow the right method of ibadah.  I have to questions Mufti Saheb, I would appreciate that if you could answer both of them.

 

I heard that according to one of the students of Imam Abu Hanifa (RA); Imam Abu Yousuf (RA), reciting the Qur’an (holding the Qur’an in hand) in namaaz is acceptable. I am a bit shocked by this statement, please help in clarifying it.
I heard from an alim saying that, reciting the Qur’an (holding the Qur’an in hand) in namaaz is not acceptable in any Mazahib.  Is the alim right.
How is Traweeh prayer Sunnat-e-Muakkadah, if Prophet (PBUH) prayed it once or twice in his life?

 

Jazak Allah Khair

 

ANSWER


Share:

 

Assalamu Alaikum Warahmatullah

 

Brother/Sister in Islam

 

According to the Hanafi Madhab, it is not permissible to hold the Quran and recite in Taraweeh. This is according to some other reliable Madhabs. Every individual should follow the teachings of his/her Imam and others should be tolerant to that.

 

A Sunnat-e-Muakkadah act could be established through the consensus of he Sahabah and their consistent practice as is the case in Taraweeh

And Allah Knows Best

 

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
